content:
That's a great plan! Creating a calorie deficit through a combination of reducing daily caloric intake and increasing physical activity is a sustainable and effective way to lose weight and reduce body fat percentage.

Eating a balanced diet with plenty of protein will help support muscle growth and maintenance, which is important for overall health and fitness. HIIT is a great way to improve cardiovascular health and burn calories, and making sure to get enough sleep and stay hydrated will help support your overall fitness goals.

Remember to start slowly and make gradual changes to your diet and exercise routine. It's better to make small, sustainable changes that you can maintain in the long term rather than trying to make drastic changes that you may not be able to stick to.

Also, don't forget to track your progress and adjust your plan as needed. Use your Omron body fat scale to track your body fat percentage, and take progress photos and measurements to track your overall progress. This will help you stay motivated and see the results of your hard work.

Remember, losing weight and reducing body fat percentage takes time and patience. Focus on making healthy lifestyle changes that you can maintain in the long term, rather than trying to lose weight quickly. You got this!

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Good luck on your fitness journey!
